articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes on Tuesday killed at least 17 Palestinians in two of the Gaza Strip's historic refugee camps and Israeli tanks pushed deeper into the enclave's southern city of Rafah, residents and medics said.
articles.title: Israeli forces deepen Rafah invasion, kill 17 in central camps

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations human rights chief on Tuesday warned that the rights situation in the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, was rapidly deteriorating, while there had been "unconscionable death and suffering" in Gaza.
articles.title: UN human rights chief: situation in West Bank 'drastically deteriorating'

articles.author: Chayut Setboonsarng, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's Senate passed the final reading of a marriage equality law on Tuesday, paving the way for it to become the first country in Southeast Asia to recognise same-sex couples.
articles.title: Thailand passes marriage equality bill, first in Southeast Asia

articles.author: Pesha Magid, Saleh Salem
articles.description: Throngs of tightly packed pilgrims struggled through searing heat which has claimed lives during the annual Haj pilgrimage as temperatures reached 51.8 degrees Celsius (125.2 Fahrenheit) in the shade of the Grand Mosque in Mecca, Saudi state TV said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Soaring temperatures scorch pilgrims on Haj in Saudi Arabia

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin, Josh Smith
articles.description: Vladimir Putin promised to build trade and security systems with North Korea that are not controlled by the West and pledged his unwavering support in a letter published by North Korean state media on Tuesday ahead of his planned visit to the country.
articles.title: Putin vows trade, security agreements with North Korea ahead of visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Philippine navy sailor suffered "serious injury" after what the country's military called on Tuesday "intentional-high speed ramming" by the Chinese coast guard during a resupply mission in the South China Sea.
articles.title: Philippines says sailor sustained serious injury in South China Sea collision

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Muslim-minority Rohingya, who were feared to be trapped amid fighting in western Myanmar, had nowhere to flee, the United Nations human rights chief said on Tuesday.
articles.title: UN rights chief: Rohingya have 'nowhere to flee' in western Myanmar fighting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Ukrainian drone strike caused a large fire in a fuel tank at an oil terminal in Russia's southern port of Azov on Tuesday, according to Russian officials and a Ukrainian intelligence source.
articles.title: Ukrainian drone attack causes fire at Russian oil terminal

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Four high-profile cases involving key political players in Thailand are scheduled to go before the courts on Tuesday, in the latest legal wrangling that could see Southeast Asia's second-largest economy plunged into a new period of uncertainty.
articles.title: Thailand braces for court cases amid risk of political crisis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Far-right party leader Jordan Bardella called on French voters on Tuesday to give his party an absolute majority in upcoming parliamentary elections so that it is able to govern effectively.
articles.title: Far-right leader Bardella says he needs absolute majority to govern France effectively
